page.title: 10Language in Eglwysbach
page.content: Fifty years ago nearly everyone in the village was Welsh-speaking. Some of the older people could not speak any English. In school only English was allowed in the classroom and the children were punished if they spoke Welsh. Outside school the children spoke Welsh and found it difficult to do their work in English. In 1985 the situation is very different. More than half of the people who live in the village are unable to speak Welsh, whilst in school most of the children use English as their first language. Although most of the children speak Welsh fluently before they leave the village school at the age of eleven, they do not use the language for play or when they meet in the street. There is more interest in the language today than ever before and money to publish books is provided by the Common Market
